page.title: 15Abbotts Ann School
page.content: Abbotts Ann Parochial Controlled Primary School is the local school for the Abbotts Ann district. The Church of England, through the Parochial Church Council, has representation on the governing body. The present school building was erected in 1905 replacing an earlier school which was burnt down. There are 67 children aged between 5 and 11 at the school. The staff is a Headmaster, 2 full-time and 2 part-time teachers. The school stands on a small playground and has three classrooms. The toilets are in a separate block on one side of the playground. The 3 acre school field lies on another site. The Village Hall across the road is used for P.E. The equipment in the school includes: 1 BBC computer, a television and a video recorder.
